@soulboykirk Slush pile is unsolicited material sent to editors. Has better chance than over the transom, but they're stories, not books.

WRITING TIP: Health & Fitness articles sell very well. Use a unique approach. More tips at http://www.creativewritinginstitute.com
WRITING TIP: Case ur market. Do they buy lots of material on ur subject? Do they pay on acceptance? http://www.creativewritinginstitute.com
WRITING TIP: Hobby and craft articles usually sell best & they pay well. More writing tips at: http://www.creativewritinginstitute.com
WRITING TIP: Write an article that is adaptable to many markets without excessive rewriting. http://www.creativewritinginstitute.com
@soulboykirk S'cuse me. What does what mean?
WRITING TIP: Over the transom=unsolicited material sent to publishing houses. Slush pile=unsolicited material sent to editors.

@ImFreckles If you do that in a fiction story, no one knows it really happened - so it's a safe place to vent.
@ImFreckles Writing through old heartaches and bitterness is wonderful therapy. It gets your feelings out in the open. (cont'd)
WRITING TIP: Sometimes a writer can't go forward until he goes back to visit his childhood, experiences, memories, places, people.
@KristenH_09 If U ever address a letter 2 the old editor, and the new editor reads it, kiss your chances goodbye. Huge no-no. Check it out.
@KristenH_09 No, don't count on them being correct - even if it is a 2010 issue. They are made up months in advance & things change.
@KristenH_09 I would invest a phone call to find out.
@cashvo Gee... I'm sorry, but no. Have not any idea about that.
@KristenH_09 General = poor economics, budgeting how-to, Michael Jackson - any current topic
@KristenH_09 Any time you use a Writer's Market, Short Story market, etc., always check 2 C if the editor is still the same person.
@KristenH_09 If U have a paper close enough 2 B interested in your news, it is a prospect. Write to match their area, or write general.

@KristenH_09 I C - then target what you can. Since it isn't local, you will have to submit regional news.

@KristenH_09 Then submit to the next closest newspaper.

WRITING TIP: Some writing needs to hit file 13. Bite the bullet and do it. Your next stab will be better.
WRITING TIP: M. H. Vorse said, "The art of writing is the art of applying the seat of the pants to the seat of the chair."
WRITING TIP: When the muse pays you a visit, don't get up for a cuppa whatever. Don't edit. Just let it keep flowing.
WRITING TIP: When you are serious about writing, turn off the phone and (heaven forbid) - Twitter. Turn off Spymaster and other games.
@maggiedana There is no scam on my site. Check it out.  http://www.creativewritinginstitute.com
WRITING TIP: Edward Bryant called writer's block "literary constipation." ROFL
@KristenH_09 Be content to start at the bottom and work your way up, hon. There are very few short cuts.  :-)
@zionian06 My tips are 4 newbs and they are general rules. All rules are made 2 be broken, so I agree with you to a point. Thanx for comment
@KristenH_09 Associated Press International - but you're shooting high. They would probably pay more.
@inkwellalley Thank you for the RT. Deb
@KristenH_09 My policy - look for open doors and squeeze through them before they shut.
@KristenH_09 But U can use the art. to show your talent and style./ Stringers work for wire services, like API. Take what you can get. lol
@tenderprey *Waving at Carole.* Thanks for the RT, hon.
@Michael737 Hey Michael. Thanks for the RT. Deb
@asoutherngirl Miss Muse comes & goes as she pleases. LOL But if U write at the same time every day, it invites her to come more regularly.
WRITING TIP: Success changes people. When you get published, don't let it change you. Share your talent freely.
WRITING TIP: Writer's block can be caused by waiting for the muse to hit you or waiting for an idea.
@KristenH_09 Don't worry about being a stringer until you have published a few articles. But if the door opens, hey - go through it!
@tenderprey N other words, roughly outline your story first, then let the characters interact within those boundaries.
@tenderprey Hey, Carole. Yes, characters will take over if U let them. Let them develop naturally within the outline you construct.
@KristenH_09 Local papers don't care a whole lot if U have never been published. Use a couple of your best AC articles as examples.
@os1019 You have a custom outdoor pic on your account. It has a hunter in it. You didn't have that made?
A reporter must have sharp eyes & ears. Cover social events, business openings, housing market, economics, anything that looks out of place.
You won't make enough money off local articles to be worth buying a scanner, unless you want it anyway.
@os1019 Thank you for the RT. I appreciate it. Your background is outstanding. Who made it for you?
WRITING TIP: Don't try to control your characters. Let them do what they want to do. Please visit http://www.creativewritinginstitute.com :)
@KristenH_09 No need to buy a scanner if U don't have one. Just stop at accidents U C. As for sentences, only use partials in dialog.
@livethchrmdlife Check out my site at http://www.creativewritinginstitute. Did I tell U my newsletter has lots of free tips? Get it there.
@KristenH_09 Partial sentences are usually used in dialog. And yes, you could use a police scanner, or just stop when U C an accident.
@KristenH_09 U have 2 know when you can use one word, half a sentence, etc. Can't just do it on a whim. Prob is, there R no governing rules.
@livethchrmdlife U aren't the only one who does this. Every writer goes thru it. I'll be happy to help when I can. Deb
@livethchrmdlife There are dozens of rules N writing. If U don't know how 2 play the game, it's harder 2 make points.
@KristenH_09 Okay, hon.
@KristenH_09 Car accidents are popular. If U want 2 B prepared 2 do them, I'll tell U how to get the most info.
@crystalbutterfl Know what? I think you did. I know I worked on it. Have been covered up lately. I'll check on it.
@KristenH_09 Varying sentence struc, using full sentences (most of the time); obeying punc rules, prevent carelessness - variety of things
@crystalbutterfl Some stories are too long and involved to be a short story.
@LaBluInk I used 2 edit as I wrote. Thot I was doing it right. Just kept me from getting real work done. (You're welcome)
@tenderprey You are so kind! Thank you.
@KristenH_09 There is a diff between short sentences and errors.  :-)
@KristenH_09 Some news is assigned, true. But accidents & small unexpected local happenings usually aren't.

@KristenH_09 Sure, go ahead, but I'm pretty covered up today. Will get to it asap.
WRITING TIP: Don't edit as U go. Don't fool yourself into thinking U R making progress when U aren't.
WRITING TIP: "Writer's block is partly a lack of courage to write badly." Ron Powers
WRITING TIP: When you hit a wall, stop writing. Go outside for 10 or 15 min. Focus on nature. Get a cuppa and go back. U will B surprised.
@nicoledenae Hi Nicole. I just followed you. Thank you for the RT. Nice to meet you. Deb
WRITING TIP: Write about what you are afraid of in your writing. Insecure? Rejection? Revealing your feelings? Experiencing pain? Write it.
@KristenH_09 Writing on present issues is always a sure seller. Now it could be budgeting, buying on credit cards, etc.
@KristenH_09 Write up the incident that night and stick it under the newspaper's door or in their box.
@KristenH_09 Write something for the local paper that is new news. Accident. Stolen bulldozer (happened). Fire. Be the first one there.
@KristenH_09 Nite, hon.
@KristenH_09 Do what feels right for you, honey. You have some decisions to make.
@reporter4651 Thank you very much. I love to help writers. Deb More tips at http://www.creativewritinginstitute.com
@asoutherngirl Thanks for the RT. I appreciate it. Deb
@reporter4651 Thank you for the RT. I appreciate it. Deb

@KristenH_09 Don't let deadlines worry U right now. One step at a time, hon. Get published first.
@BrooksSigler Thanks for the RT, Brooks. I appreciate it.  Deb
@writerscanvas Thanks for the RT. I appreciate it. Deb
@tenderprey ACK!!! The whole next 24 hrs. of tweets released all at once. Thanks for the RT though.
@KristenH_09 For now, just get pub. locally. Go in and meet the editor in person & tell him U will be submitting. Be brief.
WRITING TIP: If U can't get into your character, go to where U will find him N real life. Observe him. Hear him speak. Go home & write it.
WRITING TIP: If U aren't willing 2 let your experiences come into your writing, you are starving the muse.
WRITING TIP: Writing about your own pain means more pain - but it's great therapy. Be strong. You'll survive.
WRITING TIP: Stepping out to write an article or a story means taking risks. It's worth the risk. Jump in. Learn to swim.
WRITING TIP: Don't waste time trying 2 find the right word. You may lose the muse. Put a star there and come back 2 it later. Use Thesaurus.
WRITING TIP: U love ur characters. U want 2 help them. But don't. Let them find their own way out of their problems - or drown in them.
WRITING TIP: Skip a scene that is tough 2 write & return 2 it later. Need a writing tutor? deborahowen@cwinst.com. Free evaluations.
WRITING TIP: Leap into the abyss. Write that which you dare not speak. The Writer's Choice Nwsltr @ http://www.creativewritinginstitute.com
WRITING TIP: "No reader wants to go where no man has gone before with a nervous tour guide," Robley Wilson said. Be confident as u write.
@KristenH_09 You can make it as a reporter. Yes, you can!
@KristenH_09 Looked at the articles. Very impressive! See my email.
@KristenH_09 First you get published in your local paper. You're not ready to move beyond local until you master that.
@KristenH_09 Sure, I'll look at a couple of ACs. Just sent your email, hon.
@KristenH_09 Gonna email you with a motherly talk. lol
@KristenH_09 You're just way ahead of me, kiddo! lol Way to go!
@KristenH_09 Explain how you were "shut down". Yes, I mean locally, and in small papers all over the nation.
@KristenH_09 My dear, those rejection slips are your medals in battle. Keep some of them. Make them mean something to you besides despair.
@KristenH_09 Don't mean to get it into national newspapers. Get it into newspapers nationally. Huge diff. There is a trick to it.
@KristenH_09 500 pp - True, it may be 2 long. Research. Go 2 bookstore & ask for the newest books in your genre. Look at pg. count. Easy.
@_decode_ See email for instructions.
@KristenH_09 Seriously, print them out and frame them. #lights_aurora is making a collage of them. Centerpc w/be her 1st acceptance.
@KristenH_09 If they R thin paper, cut them into strips and use them for noodles in your next Stroganoff. lol
@KevinPocock Hey, Kev. Thx for the RT. Appreciate it. Deb
@Heidi_Colthup Hi Heidi - Thanks for the RT. Appreciate it. Deb
@lights_aurora Hey, I love that suggestion! Way to go. I'll pass that on as a tweet.
@KristenH_09   :-)   Friends.
WRITING TIP: Don't let fear of rejection keep U from submitting material. Take the risk. Frame the rejection slips. They R a challenge!
@KristenH_09 Why do you have to get to 500 pages? How did you set that goal? Some places like longer works.
@muskokaoutdoors Your background is a pic? Wowser. Beautiful. - Hubby & I like to rough it - in a 38' RV. LOL We 4-wheel in the mtns.
@reporter4651 Thanks for the RT. I appreciate you. Happy day!  Deb
@tenderprey Flaunt it. Embrace it. You'll learn to become proud of it.  :-)
@KristenH_09 Sent you another email. Next step is yours.
WRITING TIP: If you wait until U have time 2 write, the time will never come. MAKE your time to write. Get up early. Stay up late. Lunchtime
